items.title: Trump Orders Broad Effort to Root Out Groups He Says Organize Political Violence
items.summary: President Trump has long maintained that liberal activists and organizations secretly fund political violence. Law enforcement officials say efforts like the antifascist movement are often disparate groups.

items.title: With Comey Indictment, Trump Gets Retribution but Shatters Norms
items.summary: A prosecutor’s drive to indict James Comey trampled over the Justice Department’s long tradition of keeping a distance from politics and the White House, and raised the prospect of more arbitrary charges.

items.title: Prosecutor Believes Shooting at ABC Affiliate Was Politically Motivated
items.summary: The suspect in the shooting in Sacramento, a retired California lobbyist, was ordered to remain in custody without bail. His lawyer questioned why federal lawyers were involved.

items.title: James Comey, Former FBI Director, Indicted After Pressure From Trump
items.summary: The move came after the president intensified his pressure campaign on the Justice Department in recent days, publicly demanding that top officials prosecute Mr. Comey.

items.title: Chicago to Pay $90 Million to Settle Cases Tied to an Ex-Police Sergeant’s Team
items.summary: The agreement to resolve scores of lawsuits was a significant blow to a city facing budget challenges, but not as pricey as some officials had feared.

items.title: 911 Service Is Restored in Louisiana and Mississippi
items.summary: Damage to fiber optic lines operated by AT&T was to blame for the statewide outages, which lasted more than two hours on Thursday, officials said.

items.title: Trump celebrates James Comey indictment as ex-FBI director says ‘I’m innocent: let’s have a trial’ – as it happened
items.summary: <p>This blog is now closed. <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/25/james-comey-fbi-director-indictment">Read the full story here</a></p><p><strong>Dozens of House <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/democrats">Democrats</a> have signed a letter to <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump">Donald Trump</a> and secretary of state <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/marco-rubio">Marco Rubio</a>, urging the administration to recognize Palestinian statehood.</strong></p><p>The letter, led by <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/california">California</a> Democrat Ro Khanna, has 46 signatures, and lawmakers will send it to the US president on Friday, <strong>according to plans first provided to the Guardian</strong>.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/sep/25/donald-trump-james-comey-fbi-ice-texas-latest-us-politics-news-updates-live">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Trump says US will impose new tariffs on heavy trucks, drugs and kitchen cabinets
items.summary: <p>President announces 100% tariffs on imported branded drugs, 25% on heavy-duty trucks and 50% on cabinets</p><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump">Donald Trump</a> on Thursday announced a new round of punishing <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/trump-tariffs">tariffs</a>, saying the United States will impose a 100% tariffs on imported branded drugs, 25% tariff on imports of all heavy-duty trucks and 50% tariffs on kitchen cabinets.</p><p>The US president also said he would start charging a 50% tariff on bathroom vanities and a 30% tariff on upholstered furniture next week, with all the new duties to take effect from 1 October.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/25/trump-tariffs-heavy-trucks-drugs-kitchen-cabinets">Continue reading...</a>
